tourBios.exmtStatus: Finished T143 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.curYearHigh: Advanced to the Final Stage of December's Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament at PGA National, where he finished T143.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Made his first two PGA TOUR starts, missing the cut at both the U.S. Open at Merion and the RBC Canadian Open...In seven starts on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA TOUR Canada, made two cuts (T31 and T41).

2012: Played in eight Mackenzie Tour events. Made five cuts and had one top 25, a T22 at the Dakota Dunes Open. Finished 60th on the money list.

MISC: His first two Web.com Tour starts came at 2008 Athens Regional Classic and the 2009 Rex Hospital Open, missing the cut at each...Has played on a variety of professional tours including Golden Bear Tour, NGA Hooters Tour, New England Tour, Moonlight Tour, Gateway Tour, Cleveland Tour, North American Tour, Great Lakes Tour, eGolf Tour, Tar Heel Tour, Hurricane Tour, Canadian Tour, PGA TOUR Canada and European Challenge Tour.
tourBios.personal: Graduated from Oyster River High School in Durham, N.H., in 1998 and Northfield Mount Hermon in Gill, Mass., in 1999...Won Guy Smith Memorial Award for hockey in high school...Notable relatives include father, Guy Smith, who played hockey for the Ottawa 67s, the U. of New Hampshire and the New England Whalers of the WHA. He played for a WHA championship-winning team with the Whalers. His great uncle, Jay Silverheels, was an athlete and actor, who was best known for his role as Tonto in the long-running "The Lone Ranger" TV and movie series...Non-golf related jobs held include a short time working for a financial services firm...Earliest golf memories were hitting balls around the family's farmhouse in New Hampshire and having imaginery matches with Lee Trevino, Chi Chi Rodriguez and Jack Nicklaus. "I think I broke every window in the house and barn."...Biggest thrill in golf was competing in the 2013 U.S. Open at Merion and playing practice rounds with Tiger Woods, Jason Day and Steve Stricker...Biggest thrill outside golf is speaking with Indigenous youth throughout the First Nations and Native American communities in Canada and the U.S...Favorites non-golfer athletes include Dan Gable, Bobby Orr, Michael Jordan and Marvin Hagler...Not many people know his father was a full-blooded Mohawk and Jesse is enrolled as a Mohawk of the Six Nations of the Grand River, where he has lived on and off the last decade or that he almost quit the Colgate golf team to try out for the football team...Dream foursome would include his two grandfathers and his dad...Bucket list items include being able to speak Kanien'keha (Mohawk language)...Charity involvement includes Dreamcatcher Foundation...Twitter name is jesse_smith1.

tourBios.curYrHigh: Advanced to the Final Stage of December's Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament at PGA National, where he finished T143.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T was T22nd in 2012 at the Dakota Dunes Open.
